full_text:
Case 21-770, Document 20-2, 04/01/2021, 3068530, Page69 of 200
k7e2MaxC kjc
1 which you discussed with Ms. Maxwell her right to be present
2 and the indication of her knowing and voluntary waiver of that
3 right provided on this form.
4
5 MR. COHEN: Yes, your Honor. We, given the press of
6 time, we were not able to physically get the form to our
7 client, but my partner Chris Everdell and I went through it
8 with her, read it to her, and she gave us authorization to sign
9 on her behalf and that's reflected on the form in the boxes
10 where indicated, your Honor.
11 THE COURT: Okay. Ms. Maxwell, is that an accurate
12 account of what occurred?
13 THE DEFENDANT: That is completely accurate, your
14 Honor. Yes.
15 THE COURT: And you have had the form read to you or
16 you have it physically now at this point?
17 THE DEFENDANT: That is correct, your Honor.
18 THE COURT: Okay. And you have had time to discuss it
19 with your attorney?
20 THE DEFENDANT: I have, your Honor. Thank you.
21 THE COURT: Okay. And do you continue to wish to
22 waive your right to be physically present and instead to
23 proceed today by this videoconference proceeding?
24 THE DEFENDANT: Yes, your Honor.
25 THE COURT: All right. I do find a knowing and
voluntary waiver of the right to be physically present for this

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00001010
